newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Nikkei futures end firmer, eye on stocks.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Nikkei futures end firmer, eye on stocks.

text.p: SIMEX Nikkei stock futures ended firmer on Wednesday after absorbing the effects of the suspension of trade in Sumitomo Trust & Banking Co stocks.
Rumours the trust bank had incurred heavy foreign exchange losses triggered some liquidation but buying resumed after the bank denied the speculation at a press conference in Tokyo.
"Tokyo stocks fell on the rumours but there is potential for more upside," a dealer with a Japanese commission house said, adding that Nikkei futures were technically bullish.
The key Nikkei 225 June contract ended 75 points higher at 20,245, after briefly brushing lows at 20,050.

U.S. institutions were seen buying Nikkei futures following Sumitomo's denial of foreign exchange problems and also after a senior Japanese government official said downside risk to the economy had decreased.
The Nikkei was seen likely to consolidate around 20,000 points and to attempt to break 20,300 in the short-term.
Meanwhile, the SIMEX Taiwan MSCI index moved sharply higher in line with the Taiwan cash index, which posted the largest one-day gain in nine months.
The May contract rose to 342.2, up 8.8 points on a moderate volume of 1,011 lots. -- Jacqueline Wong (65 8703088)
